comment.author: 74798096@N00
comment._content: The column is from the old North Sydney Post Office.  It was placed there to mark a nautical mile - often used by vessels to calibrate logs.  The other end of the nautical mile is the mast in the tower on Fort Denison.  Until the early 1990s this measured mile was marked on charts of Sydney Harbour but was expurgated as it was felt that a high traffic zone such as this was not an ideal place to be encouraging log calibration activity.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/davideastwood] Ah yes and the Dictionary of Sydney mentions the reuse of this pillar in their history of Bradley's Head: dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/bradleys_head
